newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Abidjan bourse rises for second week.
newsitem.headline: Abidjan bourse rises for second week.

text.p: The Abidjan Stock Exchange (BVA) rose for a second successive week after ending five weeks of decline, its bourse report showed on Friday.
The BVA All-Share Index rose 0.52 percent to 362.15 in the week to Friday, taking the rise for the year to 1.21 percent.
The 12 VB blue chips index rose 0.16 percent to 241.50 points, trimming the fall on the year to 0.20 percent.
Turnover fell slightly with 4,079 shares changing hands compared to 6,176 the previous week. The value of shares traded slipped to 91,549,300 CFA francs from 110,018,000 CFA.
Agro-industrial company BLOHORN (down 50 CFA to 41,650) was the main share traded for the second time this year. Its 393 shares traded accounted for 17.69 percent of transactions.
Tobacco group SITAB, another blue-chip which fell in heavy volume as the most active stock last week, rose 2,070 CFA to 43,520.
The other main risers were oil company TOTAL-CI (up 1,660 CFA to 18,030) and maritime company SIVOM SIVO.CI (up 1,350 CFA to 14,580).
Main fallers were rubber company SOGB (down 1,430 CFA to 14,020) and cable maker SICABLE (down 1,140 CFA to 21,680).
